<p>We kindly invite to the opening ceremony of the recently founded <a href="http://www.osc.uni-muenchen.de/index.html">LMU Open Science Center</a>.</p>
<p>The center aims at fostering the engagement for open, transparent, and reproducible research. This goal is supported by: Research on research, training of researchers, and addressing relevant committees in order to create new and innovative incentive structures for open science (see <a href="http://www.osc.uni-muenchen.de">http://www.osc.uni-muenchen.de</a>).</p>
<p>We are delighted to announce that the event will be opened by <a href="http://www.cellbiology.bio.lmu.de/people/principal_investigators/barbara_conradt/index.html">Prof. Dr. Barbara Conradt</a>, Vice President for Research at the LMU. After a presentation of the OSC’s structure, goals, and key work areas, <a href="http://www.zbw.eu/de/forschung/klaus-tochtermann/">Prof. Dr. Klaus Tochtermann</a> (ZBW Kiel), one of the leading researchers in the Open Science community, will give a keynote on "Shaping the Future of Science: Open Science on a University, National, and European Level".</p>
<ul>
<li>When: Tuesday, May 8th, 2018, 18:00 to 20:00</li>
<li>Where: LMU Senate Halll (<a href="http://www.uni-muenchen.de/raumfinder/index.html#/building/bw0000/map?room=001901238_#/building/bw0000/map?room=001901238_">Room E110</a>), LMU Main Building, Geschwister-Scholl-Platz 1, 80539 Munich</li>
</ul>

<p>For planning and estimating the number of guests, we would be glad if you could RSVP via <a href="mailto:osc@fak11.lmu.de">osc@fak11.lmu.de</a>.</p>
<p>(The event language will be German).</p>
<p>Speaking for the OSC, with best regards,</p>
<p>Prof. Dr. Katrin Auspurg (Speaker)<br>PD Dr. Felix Schönbrodt (Managing Director)</p>
